page.title: 04HER MAJESTY'S VISIT
page.content: On Friday, 7th May, the Queen came to Colchester. She came mainly to open the new hospital in Myland. She was also going to the University and the Town Hall. About 3 000 children were up at the University. Our school arrived at the University at about 10.30. We had to wait for about an hour and fifteen minutes before she arrived. In that space of time we had a chat with a policeman. There were also policemen on top of the tall buildings. Before the Queen came there was an escort. The Queen was wearing a green coat and a red hat. She came past us on the other side so we couldn't see her. Down at the place where she went in there were hundreds of people. She was staying at the University for an hour. After she had come past the first time we went and got our lunch.
